scenarioDescription:
The HD 45364 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 45364 is a star with 0.82 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 112.05 light years away from the solar system.

HD 45364 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 45364 system


HD 45364 b

HD 45364 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2009-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.68 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 45364 b is 59.530 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 45364 b is 8.970 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 45364 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 45364 c

HD 45364 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2009-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.90 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 45364 c is 209.212 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 45364 c is 14.100 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 45364 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 45364, which contains 2 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 45364 - System With 2 Exoplanets
